# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    line = ""
    words = split(text, " ")
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            line *= "\n" * (length(split(line, r"\n")) + 1)
            line *= word
        else
            line *= word * " "
        end
    end
    line
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.")
"The\nquick brown fox \njumps over \nthe lazy dog.\n"

julia> wrap_string("This is a very long text that will be wrapped.", 15)
"This is a very long text that will be wrapped.\n"
```
